Item.Description: Open stitch with a very elegant appearance. Short 4 row pattern
Item.Chart: Row1: K1, *K1, K2tog, yo, K1, yo, ssk, K1* rep** to last stitch, K1 Row2: Purl Row3: K1, *K2tog, yo, K3, yo, ssk* rep** to last stitch, K1 Row4: Purl
Item.Notes: k2tog = knit 2 together (through front of next two stiches at once) yo = yarn over (wrap the yarn from back to front counterclockwise) ssk = slip slip knit, slip next two stitches onto the right needle (one at a time) as if to knit, insert left needle into fronts of both stitches and knit them together

Item.Chart: Row1: *P4, K1, P1, K4* rep** to end Row2: *P3, K2, P2, K3* rep** to end Row3: *P2, K2, P1, K1, P2, K2* rep** to end Row4: *P1, K2, P2, K2, P2, K1* rep** to end Row5: *K2, P3, K3, P2* rep** to end Row6: *K1, P4, K4, P1* rep** to end Repeat these 6 rows for pattern

Item.Description: Super cute especially with thinner thread and smaller needles
Item.Chart: Row1: Knit Row2: K5 *P3, K5* rep** to end Row3: P5 *K3, P5* rep** to end Row4: K5 *P3, K5* rep** to end Row5: Knit Row6: K1 *P3, K5* rep** to last 4 stitches, P3, K1 Row7: P1 *K3, P5* rep** to last 4 stitches, K3, P1 Row8: K1 *P3, K5* rep** to last 4 stitches, P3, K1 Repeat these 8 rows for pattern

Item.Description: I am making an afghan using this stitch and I LOVE LOVE LOVE it!! I am varying how many knit rows that I include after row 2, I include 4 to 6 rows to give the afghan interest and vary the thickness of the solid stripe between the shell pattern.
Item.Chart: Row1: Knit across wrapping the yarn twice around the needle for each stitch Row2: Sl4 purlwise (dropping second wrap of each stitch) and then knit 4 slipped stitches together, *yo, (K1, yo) 5 times (drop second wrap of each stitch that you knit), Sl7 (dropping second wrap of each stitch) then knit 7 slipped stitches together.* rep** to last 4 stitches (looks like 8 on needle due to double wrap) slip 4 purlwise (dropping second wrap of each stitch) then knit 4 slipped stitches together. Row 3 - 6: Knit Repeat these 6 rows for pattern
Item.Notes: knit the slipped stitches together by inserting the left needle left to right through all slipped stitches then knitting them together.

Item.Description: need cable needle or extra dp needle
Item.Chart: Row1: K2 P6 K2 Row2: P2 K6 P2 Row3: K2 P6 K2 Row4: P2 C6 P2 Row5: K2 P6 K2 Row6: P2 K6 P2 Repeat these 6 rows for pattern
Item.Notes: C6 = slip next 3 stitches on cable needle and hold to front or back knit the next three stitches from left needle then knit the stitches on cable needle cable will twist to the right if held to the front and to the left if held to the back

Item.Description: Great for Scarves, especially if you use mulitple colors to really show off that zig zag pattern.
Item.Chart: Row1: K2 *K1B&F, K4, (Sl1, K2tog, psso), K4, K1B&F* rep** to last 2 stitches, K2 Row2: K2 *P til last 2* rep** to last 2 stitches, K2 Repeat these 2 rows for pattern
Item.Notes: (Sl1, K2tog, psso) = slip the next stitch knit wise, knit the next to stitches together, pass the slipped stitch over the knit stitch and off the needle. K1B&F = knit into the back and then the front of the same stitch.

Item.Chart: Row1: K3 *P3, K3* rep** to end Row2: P3 *K3, P3* rep** to end Row3: K3 *P3, K3* rep** to end Row4: K1 *P3, K3* rep** to last 2 stitches, P2 Row5: K2 *P3, K3* rep** to last stitch, P1 Row6: K1 *P3, K3* rep** to last 2 stitches, P2 Row7: K1 *P3, K3* rep** to last 2 stitches, P2 Row8: K2 *P3, K3* rep** to last stitch, P1 Row9: K1 *P3, K3* rep** to last 2 stitches, P2 Row10: K3 *P3, K3* rep** to end Row11: P3 *K3, P3* rep** to end Row12: K3 *P3, K3* rep** to end Row13: P2 *K3, P3* rep** to last stitch, K1 Row14: P1 *K3, P3* rep** to last 2 stitches, K2 Row15: P2 *K3, P3* rep** to last stitch, K1 Row16: P2 *K3, P3* rep** to last stitch, K1 Row17: P1 *K3, P3* rep** to last 2 stitches, K2 Row18: P2 *K3, P3* rep** to last stitch, K1 Repeat these 18 rows for pattern

Item.Description: You can add these fans anywhere. Once you get the hang of the pattern you can add these to any stockinette based pattern. You can decrease the number of stockinette rows in between to make the pattern closer together. Be sure to decrease the number of rows in sets of two if you want to decrease the space between 'fans'
Item.Chart: Rows 1 - 12: Stockinette Stitch (Knit the odd rows, Purl the even rows) Row13: K1, *insert needle 4 rows below the third stitch on the left needle, draw up a loop and leave it on the right needle, K3, draw up a loop through same stitch as before (4 below), K2, draw up a loop through same stitch as before, K5* rep** to last stitch, K1 Row14: P1, *P5, P2tog, P1, P2tog, P1, P2tog* rep** to last stitch, P1 Rows 15 - 26: Stockinette Stitch (Knit the odd rows, Purl the even rows) Row27: K1, *K5, insert needle 4 rows below the third stitch on the left needle, draw up a loop and leave it on the right needle, K3, draw up a loop through same stitch as before (4 below), K2, draw up a loop through same stitch as before* rep** to last stitch, K1 Row28: P1, * P2tog, P1, P2tog, P1, P2tog, P5* rep** to last stitch, P1 Repeat these 28 rows for pattern
Item.Notes:
P2tog = Purl 2 together (through front of next 2 stitches at once)
Email stitchomania for additional directions if you need help with this one, it is easy once you get the hang of it.

Item.Chart: Knit every row

Row1: K1 *P1, K9, P1, K1* rep** to end Row2: K1 *P1, K1, P7, K1, P1, K1* rep** to end Row3: K1 *P1, K1, P1, K5, P1, K1, P1, K1* rep ** to end Row4: P1 *P1, K1, P1, K1, P3, K1, P1, K1, P2* rep ** to end Row5: K1 *K2, P1, K1, P1, K1, P1, K1, P1, K3* rep** to end Row6: P1 *P3, K1, P1, K1, P1, K1, P4* rep** to end Row7: K1 *K4, P1, K1, P1, K5* rep** to end Row8: P1 *P3, K1, P1, K1, P1, K1, P4* rep** to end Row9: K1 *K2, P1, K1, P1, K1, P1, K1, P1, K3* rep** to end Row10: P1 *P1, K1, P1, K1, P3, K1, P1, K1, P2* rep ** to end Row11: K1 *P1, K1, P1, K5, P1, K1, P1, K1* rep ** to end Row12: K1 *P1, K1, P7, K1, P1, K1* rep** to end Repeat these 12 rows for pattern
Row1: Knit Row2: Purl Row3: K1 *P2, K1* rep** to end Row4: Purl Repeat these 4 rows for pattern

Item.Description: It’s a long pattern but so worth it to add a pop to a scarf or sweater. You will need a cable needle or an extra double point needle.
Item.Chart: Cast on 22 stitches Row1: P10, K2, P10 Row2: K10, P2, K10 Row3: P10, K2, P10 Row4: K10, P2, K10 Row5: P10, K2, P10 Row6: K10, P2, K10 Row7: P9, T2B, K1, P10 Row8: K10, P1, K1, P1, K9 Row9: P8, T2B, K2, P10 Row10: K10, P2, K1, P1, K8 Row11: P7, T2B, P1, K2, P10 Row12: K10, P2, K2, P1, K7 Row13: P6, T2B, P2, K2, P10 Row14: K10, P2, K3, P1, K6 Row15: P6, yo, K1, yo, P3, K2, P10 Row16: K10, P2, K3, P3, K6 Row17: P6, K1, yo, K1, yo, K1, P3, K2, P10 Row18: K10, P2, K3, P5, K6 Row19: P6, K2, yo, K1, yo, K2, P3, K1, T2F, P9 Row20: K9, P1, K1, P1, K3, P7, K6 Row21: P6, K3, yo, K1, yo, K3, P3, K2, T2F, P8 Row22: K8, P1, K1, P2, K3, P9, K6 Row23: P6, K2tog(tbl), K5, K2tog, P3, K2, P1, T2F, P7 Row24: K7, P1, K2, P2, K3, P7, K6 Row25: P6, K2tog(tbl), K3, K2tog, P3, K2, P2, T2F, P6 Row26: K6, P1, K3, P2, K3, P5, K6 Row27: P6, K2tog(tbl), K1, K2tog, P3, K2, P3, yo, K1, yo, P6 Row28: K6, P3, K3, P2, K3, P3, K6 Row29: P6, K3tog, P3, K2, P3, K1, yo, K1, yo, K1, P6 Row30: K6, P5, K3, P2, K3, P1, K6 Row31: P9, T2B, K1, P3, K2, yo, K1, yo, K2, P6 Row32: K6, P7, K3, P1, K1, P1, K9 Row33: P8, T2B, K2, P3, K3, yo, K1, yo, K3, P6 Row34: K6, P9, K3, P2, K1, P1, K8 Row35: P7, T2B, P1, K2, P3, K2tog(tbl), K5, K2tog, P6 Row36: K6, P7, K3, P2, K2, P1, K7 Row37: P6, T2B, P2, K2, P3, K2tog(tbl), K3, K2tog, P6 Row38: K6, P5, K3, P2, K3, P1, K6 Row39: P6, yo, K1, yo, P3, K2, P3, K2tog(tbl), K1, K2tog, P6 Row40: K6, P3, K3, P2, K3, P3, K6 Row41: P6, K1, yo, K1, yo, K1, P3, K2, P3, K3tog, P6 Row42: K6, P1, K3, P2, K3, P5, K6 Repeat rows 19-42 to continue the pattern
Item.Notes:
T2B = Twist 2 Back, slip the next stitch to a cable needle and leave it at the back, knit the next stitch then purl the stitch on the cable needle.
T2F = Twist 2 Front, slip the next stitch onto a cable needle and leave it at the front, purl the next stitch then knit the stitch from the cable needle.
K2tog(tbl) = Knit 2 together through the back loops (a regular K2tog is knitting 2 together through the front loops)

Item.Description: I labelled this as 'Hard' t because it might take one or two tries before you get the more complicated parts of this stitch down right away. Adds 'relief' to any project
Item.Chart: Rows 1 - 4: Knit Row5: K5 *(K1, P1, K1, P1) in same stitch, K5* rep** to end Row6: K5 *(slip3, K1, psso each slipped stitch separately), K5* rep** to end Rows 7-10: Knit Row11: K8 *(K1, P1, K1, P1) in same stitch, K5* rep** to last 3 stitches, K3 Row12: K8, *(slip3, K1, psso each slipped stitch separately), K5* repeat to last 3 stitches, K3 Repeat these 12 rows for the pattern
Item.Notes: (K1, P1, K1,P1) all in same stitch = Knit 1 but before you take the stitch off the left needle switch yarn to front and purl in to stitch and with the stitch still on the left needles, switch yarn to back and knit, with stitch still on the needle switch yarn to front and purl, finish the stitch by dropping it off the left needle.

Item.Chart: Row1: *K2 P2* rep** to end Row2: *P2 K2* rep** to end Repeat

Row1: Knit Row2: Purl Row3: K1 *k2tog, yo, K2* rep** to last 2 stitches, K2 Row4: Purl Row5: Knit Row6: Purl Row7: K1 *K2, ssk, yo* rep** to last 2 stitches, K2 Row8: Purl Repeat these 8 rows for pattern
Item.Notes: k2tog = knit 2 together (through front of next two stiches at once) yo = yarn over (wrap the yarn from back to front counterclockwise) ssk = slip slip knit, slip next two stitches onto the right needle (one at a time) as if to knit, insert left needle into fronts of both stitches and knit them together

Item.Description: Simple and adds stability, a nice tight fabric once knit.
Item.Chart: Row1: Knit Row2: K1 *Sl1 wyib, K1* rep** to end Row3: Knit Row4: K2 *Sl1 wyib, K1* rep** to last sticht, K1 Repeat these 4 rows for pattern
Item.Notes: wyib = With Yarn In Back, when you slip the stitch make sure you hold the yarn at the back.

Item.Chart: Row1: Knit Row2: Purl Repeat

Item.Description: Simple but adds texture and interest
Item.Chart: Row1: Knit Row2: *P6, K2* rep** to end Row3: *P2, K6* rep** to end Row4: Purl Row5: Knit Row6: P2 *K2, P6* to last 6 stitches, K2, P4 Row7: K4, P2 *K6, P2* rep** to last 2 stitches, K2 Row8: Purl Repeat these 8 rows for pattern

Row1: K1, P3 *sl3 purlwise with yarn at front, P3* rep ** to last stitch, K1 Row2: P1, K3 *sl3 purlwise with yarn at back, K3* rep** to last stitch, P1 Row3: K1, P3 *K3, P3* rep** to last stitch, K1 Row4: P1, K3 *P3, K3* rep** to last stitch, P1 Row5: K5 *pull up loops (see note), K5* rep** to end Row6: K1, P3 *K3, P3* rep** to last stitch, K1 Row7: P1 *sl3 purlwise with yarn at front, P3* rep** to last 4 stitches, sl3 purlwise, P1 Row8: K1 *sl3 purlwise with yarn at back, K3* rep** to last 4 stitches, sl3 purlwise, K1 Row9: P1, K3 *P3, K3* rep** to last stitch, P1 Row10: K1, P3 *K3, P3* rep** to last stitch, K1 Row11: K2 *pull up loops, K5* rep** to last 3 stitches, pull up loops, K2 Row12: P1, K3 *P3, K3* rep** to last stitch, P1 Repeat these 12 rows for pattern
Item.Notes: Pull up loops: note the loops created by the slipped stitches below the stitch you are about to work. Insert right needle upwards through both loops and knit the next stitch, pulling the stitch through the 2 loops, letting them off the needles and keeping the knitted stitch on the left needle.

Item.Description: OMG I love love love this stitch! It's so chunky and wonderful!
Item.Chart: Row1: Purl Row2: *(K1, P1, K1) all in the same stitch, P3tog* rep** to end Row3: Purl Row4: *P3tog, (K1, P1, K1) all in the same stitch* rep** to end
Item.Notes: It is also know as the cluster stitch or bramble stitch. p3tog = purl 3 together (through front of next 3 stitches at once) (K1, P1, K1) all in same stitch = Knit 1 but before you take the stitch off the left needle switch yarn to front and purl in to stitch and with the stitch still on the left needles, switch yarn to back and knit, finish the stitch by dropping it off the left needle.

Item.Chart: Row1: K3 *P3 K3* rep** to end Row2: P3 *K3, yo, P3* rep** to end Row3: K3 *P4, K3* rep** to end Row4: P3 *K1, K2tog, yo, K1, P3* rep** to end Row5: K3 *P2, p2tog, K3* rep** to end Row6: P3 *K1, yo, k2tog, P3* rep** to end Repeat these 6 rows
Item.Notes: yo = yarn over (wrap the yarn from back to front counterclockwise) k2tog = knit 2 together (through front of next two stiches at once) p2tog = purl 2 together (through front of next 2 stitches at once)

Item.Chart: Row1: *K2, P1* rep** to last 2 stitches, K2 Row2: K3 *P2, K1* rep** to last 2 stitches, K2 Row3: *K2, P1* rep** to last 2 stitches, K2 Row4: Knit Repeat these 4 rows for pattern
Row1: Knit Row2: *K1, P1* rep** to last stitch, K1 Repeat these 2 rows for pattern
